title: What is AI?
content: AI is pattern recognition at scale. Math plus data plus computing power. Pattern matching that recognizes cats, spam, faces. Not mystical, just really good pattern matching.

title: The Three Levels of AI
content: Narrow AI for one specific task like spam filters. General Purpose AI handles many tasks like Claude, Gemini, GPT. AGI is human-level intelligence and doesn't exist yet.

title: AI vs Machine Learning vs Deep Learning
content: Russian doll analogy. AI is the big umbrella. Machine Learning improves from data. Deep Learning uses neural networks with many layers.

title: Machine Learning Explained
content: Traditional programming is human writes rules, computer follows. Machine learning is human provides examples, computer discovers rules. System improves itself by looking at data.

title: Supervised Learning
content: Teaching with flashcards. Give machine data AND correct answers. Used for loan default prediction, disease diagnosis from X-rays, spam filtering.

title: Unsupervised Learning
content: Give AI data but no answers. Find patterns without labels. Customer segmentation, anomaly detection, market basket analysis. Discovers unknown patterns.

title: Reinforcement Learning
content: Trial and error with rewards. Like training a dog with treats. Used for robotics, trading algorithms, self-driving cars, game AI like AlphaGo.

title: Garbage In Garbage Out
content: Data quality is everything. Your AI is only as good as your data. Bias in data leads to bias in predictions. Amazon's hiring AI learned gender bias from historical data.

title: Data Strategy for Leaders
content: Data Governance: who owns data, is it legal to use. Data Lineage: trace where information came from. Data Diversity: does data represent all customers.

title: Deep Learning & Neural Networks
content: Neural networks with multiple layers. Figures out important features automatically. Layer 1 detects edges, Layer 2 shapes, Layer 3 parts, Layer 4 objects.

title: CNN - Convolutional Neural Networks
content: Built for images and vision. Tesla cameras, medical imaging, facial recognition, manufacturing quality control. Learns position-independent patterns.

title: RNN - Recurrent Neural Networks
content: Built for sequences where order matters. Text, time series, audio. Has memory. Used for word prediction, speech recognition, stock prices.

title: Transformers Architecture
content: Attention Is All You Need paper from 2017. Looks at entire sequence at once. Powers GPT, Claude, Gemini. Context windows up to 3M+ tokens.

title: Multimodal AI
content: AI that handles text, images, audio, video simultaneously. Claude 4.5, Gemini 3, Grok 4.1 are natively multimodal. Can see, hear, and speak.

title: Reasoning Models & Test-Time Compute
content: Models like OpenAI o1, o3 that think before speaking. Chain of Thought reasoning. The more time to think, the better the answer. RLVR training.

title: Small Language Models (SLMs)
content: Microsoft Phi, Gemini Nano, distilled Llama. Run on device without internet. Privacy benefits. 100x cheaper and faster. 140x more efficient than 2023.

title: RAG - Retrieval Augmented Generation
content: Open book solution for AI. Retrieves relevant documents from database. Generates answer based on verified data. Stops hallucinations, keeps data current.

title: AI Agents Introduction
content: Chatbot talks, agent works for you. Task-oriented, autonomous. Search web, use tools, connect to APIs. Multi-agent systems work together.

title: Prediction vs Judgment
content: AI lowers the cost of prediction. Humans still own judgment. Prediction tells probabilities. Judgment decides the response. AI makes judgment more powerful.

title: Buy vs Build Framework
content: Should you train your own model or use API? Buy is instant and cheap to start. Build needs hard-to-find AI talent. Buy first, only build if unique data advantage.

title: The API Revolution
content: You don't need a PhD to use AI anymore. Just need an API key. Cost dropped 280-fold since 2022. Startups can add world-class AI in a weekend.

title: What is Generative AI?
content: AI that creates new content. Text, images, code, music. Prediction on steroids. Traditional AI is a librarian, Generative AI is a writer.

title: How Generative AI Works
content: Prediction on steroids. Calculates highest probability next word. Playing sophisticated game of what word comes next, hundreds of times per response.

title: First Draft Costs Zero
content: The first draft of anything now costs basically zero. Work shifted from creation to curation and editing. Like shift from hand-copying to printing press.

title: Large Language Models (LLMs)
content: GPT, Claude, Gemini, Llama. Neural networks trained on text. GPT-5.2 has 3.5+ trillion parameters. DeepSeek proved efficiency beats raw size.

title: Mixture of Experts (MoE)
content: Like a hospital floor instead of one doctor. Total parameters is all knowledge. Active parameters is the subset used for your specific prompt.

title: RAG vs Fine-tuning
content: Fine-tuning is like med school, teaches behavior and style. RAG is like a textbook, teaches facts. 90% of business use cases need RAG not fine-tuning.

title: LLM Training Recipe
content: Pretraining reads internet. Supervised Fine-Tuning shows good examples. RLHF for human vibe. RLVR for logic and math verification rewards.

title: Comparing LLM Models
content: Claude 4.5 Opus is IQ King for programming and writing. GPT-5.2 is powerhouse generalist. Gemini 3 Pro handles 3M+ tokens. Llama 4 is open-source standard.

title: LLM Pricing
content: Pay per token not per word. Input tokens are cheaper, output tokens more expensive. Generation runs full network for every token. CAPEX vs OPEX.

title: LLM Benchmarks
content: Humanity's Last Exam for PhD-level reasoning. SWE-bench for software engineering. GPQA Diamond for expert knowledge. LMSYS Arena for human preference.

title: Hallucinations & Grounding
content: AI generates false information confidently. Fix with grounding: force AI to cite sources. Answer using ONLY provided document. Never use raw LLM for factual queries.

title: Tokens and Context Windows
content: Tokens are word pieces, about 4 characters. Context window is AI working memory. 1000 tokens equals 750 words. Gemini 3 Pro has 3M+ token context.

title: Prompt Engineering
content: How you ask matters. Perfect prompt formula: Role, Context, Task. System prompts set behavior. Few-shot examples guide output. Chain of thought for reasoning.

title: Zero-Shot Prompting
content: Just ask directly with no examples. Works for simple unambiguous tasks. Translate, define, explain. Fails for nuanced tasks where format isn't obvious.

title: Few-Shot Prompting
content: Show input-output example pairs first. Model sees pattern and applies it. Classification, formatting, style transfer. More examples make pattern clearer.

title: Chain of Thought Prompting
content: Tell AI to reason through problem before answering. Think step by step. Prevents jumping to wrong conclusions. Best for math, logic, multi-step analysis.

title: Temperature Setting
content: Controls randomness in token selection. Temperature 0 is deterministic for code and facts. Temperature 0.7-0.9 for creative writing. High temperature for wild ideas.

title: From Chatbots to Agents
content: Chatbot talks, agent does. Goal-following vs recipe-following. Agent is like hiring assistant who does the work. Specify outcome, AI figures out steps and executes.

title: Traditional Software vs AI Agents
content: Traditional software follows explicit rules. Agents follow goals and reason through obstacles. Agents handle situations developer never programmed for.

title: Human-in-the-Loop
content: Agent does work but pauses for human approval before dangerous actions. The Copilot model: agent proposes, human disposes. Always demand HITL switch for spending money.

title: How Agents Work
content: Four core components: Brain (LLM), Tools (hands), Planning, Observation. The agent loop: think, act, observe, repeat until goal complete.

title: The Agent Loop
content: Think: reason about what to do. Act: call a tool. Observe: see what happened. Agents reason through obstacles that weren't pre-programmed.

title: Tools - The Agent's Hands
content: LLM can only generate text, tools let it act. Computer Use, web search, browse, code execution, email, database queries. Like apps on a smartphone.

title: Computer Use
content: AI that controls mouse and keyboard. OpenAI Operator, Claude computer use. Vision-based interaction. Uses any app without needing specific API. The master key.

title: Tool Descriptions
content: AI reads tool descriptions to decide which to use. Good descriptions lead to correct tool choice. Write descriptions like explaining to smart but uninformed person.

title: Agent Security - Prompt Injection
content: Nightmare scenario: hacker embeds instructions in email that agent follows. SQL Injection of the AI era. Never give agent god mode permissions. Use spending limits.

title: Agent Memory Systems
content: Short-term memory is conversation context in context window. Long-term memory uses vector databases for cross-session memory. Semantic search by meaning.

title: Vector Databases
content: Store text as numerical vectors representing meaning. Search by similarity, not keywords. Pinecone, Chroma, Weaviate, Qdrant. Enables remembering across sessions.

title: Reflection Pattern
content: Agent reviews its own work before delivering. Self-proofreading catches errors. Code generation: run code, observe errors, fix, run again until works.

title: Planning Pattern
content: Create roadmap before executing. Without planning, agents go in circles or miss steps. Front-loads thinking. Makes dependencies explicit.

title: Multi-Agent Systems
content: Multiple specialized agents work together. Researcher, Writer, Editor, Fact-checker. Each agent has narrow focus. CrewAI, AutoGen, LangGraph frameworks.

title: Best Models for Agents
content: GPT-5.2 and Claude 4.5 Opus are top tier. Gemini 3 Flash is the sweet spot for developers. Llama 4 for private on-prem agents. Need strong reasoning and tool-use.

title: Running Models Locally
content: Ollama for local inference on your computer. LM Studio GUI. AWS Bedrock and Azure OpenAI for cloud with data sovereignty. Privacy and offline use benefits.

title: Agent Frameworks
content: PydanticAI for enterprise. CrewAI for multi-agent teams. OpenAI Agents SDK for GPT integration. LangGraph for complex workflows. Smolagents for lightweight agents.

title: AI History Timeline
content: 1956 birth of AI. AI Winters in 70s-90s. 2012 ImageNet breakthrough with GPUs. 2017 Transformers paper. 2022 ChatGPT explosion. 2025 Claude 4.5 and Gemini 3.

title: Open vs Closed Models
content: Closed models like GPT, Claude are smartest and easiest. Open models like Llama give control and privacy. Open models slightly dumber but no vendor lock-in.

title: Context Window Explained
content: Everything AI can see at once. Current message, conversation history, documents, system prompt. Legacy was 8K tokens. Gemini 3 Pro has 3M+ tokens.

title: Agent Economy
content: Agents talking to agents. Personal shopping agent negotiates with travel agency agent. Agents will have digital wallets. Is your website agent-readable?

title: Measuring Agent Performance
content: Success rate without human intervention. Cost per task. Resolution time vs human. Customer sentiment for client-facing agents.
